title: Advanced Daisenryaku: Doitsu Dengeki Sakusen

description:
It's vacation time for Maruko and her friends. Hanawa, the ladies' man with rich parents, invites Maruko and Tamae to an island down south to relax, and rounding out the group, Maruo butts in and comes along as well. Since they're going to get souvenirs and such while they're there, they decide to make a game of it and see who is best at shopping!

Waku Waku Shopping is a sugoroku-style board game based on the popular characters created by Momoko Sakura. The game takes place on a board made up of various spaces: there are spaces which increase or decrease the character's money or happiness, spaces where the player can spend their money to buy things to increase their happiness, and spaces that trigger various events. The game ends when the goal has been reached a set number of times, and the winner is the player with the most happiness at the end of the game. Up to four players can play, with the computer taking control of any remaining characters.

sample_screenshots.caption: This old guy explains the rules.
Why, of course she'll come too!

title: Chibi Maruko-chan: Waku Waku Shopping

description:
Funny World & Balloon Boy is an unlicensed two-in-one cartridge containing two simple games:

Funny World is an action game where the player must shoot strange animals as they move across the screen. On each stage a set number of "funnys" will cross the screen, and the player must shoot a certain number of them before they can safely reach the other side. To make things harder, some will walk, some will run, and some will move erratically; from time to time a female funny will cross the screen, which if shot will cause the player to lose a life. They player also has a certain number of boulders they can drop, which will hit any funny on the screen that may be out of the player's range. If enough funnys are hit, the player moves on to the next stage.

Balloon Boy is an action game where the player controls a boy at the bottom of the screen who must shoot at balloons floating across the top. When shot, the balloons will release either a trap or an item, and the boy must collect the items while avoiding the traps. If all the balloons are destroyed before the time runs out, the player moves on to the next stage.

sample_screenshots.caption: Funny World - about to hit one
Funny World - Dropping a boulder on a funny
Funny World - it's too fast - I missed this one
Balloon Boy - The current stages background

title: Funny World & Balloon Boy

description: The princess has been kidnapped by a strange creature! What to do? Grab a mallet and bash heads in until you can get her back, that's what! Mallet Legend's Whac-A-Critter is based on the classic coin-operated redemption game Whac-A-Mole. Each stage has nine holes, out of which various creatures appear. The player must hit as many of the "bad" creatures as possible, while leaving the princess and the dog untouched. Some creatures wear helmets and must be hit several times to be defeated. Between each stage, there are minigames where bonus points can be earned, and there are six stages total. Also supported is a special nine-button "Smash Controller" specific to this game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Intro - but the prince is going to rescue the princess

title: Mallet Legend's Whac-A-Critter

description:
Yokohama Pachi-Pachi Chinatown is an island where all the people love pachinko. One day, a mysterious evil panda decides he must have it, and steals it for himself, turning it into his own personal pachinko island, a place where anyone who enters can never leave. Chen is a man who loves pachinko, and one day he heads of to the famous pachinko parlors of Yokohama...and never returns. Fortune tells that very soon, the person who will stop the evils of this pachinko parlor will appear, and Chen's daughter, Ren, sets out on her 18th birthday for Yokohama, looking for her father.

Pachinko Kuunyan is a pachinko game much like the Pachio-kun series. The player navigates Ren through overhead areas, entering pachinko halls and playing the machines. Each of the five cities has several pachinko halls, and Ren must empty out a certain number of machines before she can move on to the next city. If she runs out of balls, then the game is over.
title: Pachinko Kuunyan

description: A terrorist group has taken control of an armed satellite and is attacking all the nations of the Earth. Your mission: infiltrate and recapture the satellite...by answering trivia questions. Riddle Wired is a Japanese-style quiz game, and despite the scenario, the entirety of the game consists of answering general knowledge questions. The player will face a series of different opponents during the mission, and each one will ask the player a series of questions in a so-called "Quiz Battle". If the player answers correctly, the enemy will lose HP; if not, then the player will lose HP. If the enemy's HP is drained, the player moves on to the next stage, but if all HP is lost then the game is over. One or two players can play simultaneously.

sample_screenshots.caption: Answering the question wrong lowers your HP

title: Riddle Wired: Quiz Dokusen Kigyō no Hōkai

description:
F1 Super License is the third and final Satoru Nakajima F1 game for the Mega Drive. Eschewing the cockpit view of F-1 Hero MD, this release returns to the top-down view of the earlier F1 Grand Prix. It features an official FOCA license and represents the 1992 season.

There are three modes available: GP mode, which lets the player play a 16-race season as their preferred driver; Spot mode, where the player can play a custom race against a full field; and Test mode, where the player can practice to build their skills. The player can adjust their vehicle's engine, tires, brakes, suspension, and spoiler to their tastes between races, and can also play a free run before competing. The game has three GP mode save files, and will also record the best times for each course.

sample_screenshots.caption: The arrow signifies that a curve in the road is ahead

title: Nakajima Satoru Kanshū F1 Super License

description:
In the year 2020, the computer controlling the world has been corrupted by a virus and is out of control. Scentists create a warship, the "Space Turtle Battleship", to fight against it. Two young pilots, Titi and Koti, take the helm and blast off to fight the out-of-control computer.

Uju Geobukseon ("Space Turtle Battleship") is a vertically-scrolling shooter in which the player controls the titular battleship. Like most any scrolling shooter, the player must shoot down various enemies without allowing the ship to be hit and destroyed, and there is a large boss waiting at the end of each stage. The ship has two different modes of fire, which will shoot in different directions; if three power-ups are collected, the number of bullets fired will increase. There are three difficulty settings available.
title: Uju Geobukseon

description: RISK is a conversion of the popular strategy board game created by Parker Brothers. Players control armies placed in different regions of the world, attacking opposing players' armies to gain territory, and ultimately try to wipe out the other factions and take over the world. In addition to the regular classic mode, which works just like the original board game, there is also an arcade mode, where skirmishes between factions give the player direct control of cannons to attack the opposing player. Any combination of up to six human and computer players can compete for world domination.

sample_screenshots.caption: If arcade mode is turned off, the computer controls the cannons
Players get an army bonus for taking over entire continents
If the arcade mode is on, players control the firing of the cannons

title: Risk: Parker Brothers' World Conquest Game

description: Triple Play: Gold Edition is an update of the previous year's title. It looks and plays very much like the previous title, including the close-up batting view and extensive stat tracking. The game features an MLBPA license, with a full 1996 season roster and stats based on the 1995 season. Additionally, this update adds a new "pro" difficulty level for experienced players, and just like the previous title also allows for up to four players to play.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game needs some time to sort out the stats

title: Triple Play: Gold Edition

description: Superman is a single player, action based platformer for the Sega Genesis. As the Man of Steel, you jump, punch and kick your way through several levels, battling the likes of Prankster, Metallo, and Mr. Mxyzptlk to keep Metropolis safe. After the initial levels, the evil Brainiac kidnaps Lois Lane and takes her to his space station. Some levels take place in flight, and allow you to not only fly but shoot lasers from Superman's eyes. On the ground, you can collect icons that allow you to use a super power once, often a super punch or spin attack to remove an obstacle in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: A boss battle at the top of the building
Item that will quickly refill Superman's punch power

title: Superman

description:
The McCallister family is off to Miami for a Christmas vacation in the sun. The son, Kevin, ends up on the wrong plane and winds up in New York City all by himself. The two-man bandit team he helped catch in the first film also just so happen to be there, and are out for revenge.

Home Alone 2 is an action platform game based loosely on the 1992 film of the same title. Starting in the airport, the player controls Kevin as he runs around New York, visiting locations similar to those in the film, and outwitting the bandits Harry and Marv, who turn up to harass him at almost every turn. Kevin has a variety of kid-friendly weaponry handy to take on his enemies, including baseballs, footballs, and slingshots.
title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York

description:
Counting Cafe is an educational game based on the popular children's show Sesame Street. The player controls Grover, working as a waiter at a restaurant, where Mr. Johnson appears and orders various items. The player must take Grover into the kitchen, collect the items ordered, and return to Mr. Johnson's table, where he will reward the player with a star if the order is correct. If the player picks up the wrong items, they can be taken to Cookie Monster at the back of the restaurant, who will eat them and clear Grover's tray.

There are five sections to each "day" -- Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, and Dessert. Once the player has completed Dessert, a monkey will run by and snatch the last star. Grover then must chase after the monkey to retrieve his last star, after which the game will move on to the next day.

After the first day, Sesame Street denizens will start appearing in the kitchen playing around with food items. Sometimes their activities with a food item will end up landing on Grover's tray, which may result in Grover carrying an unwanted food item, forcing him to give the food to Cookie Monster and having to collect the correct food items all over again.

sample_screenshots.caption: Feeding unwanted food to Cookie Monster to clear the tray
A new meal is ordered for brunch
He stuffs his face when the correct meal is brought to him
Who would of thought that Sesame Street had a crime problem

title: Sesame Street: Counting Cafe

description: Power Challenge Golf is a golf simulation game, based on Accolade's own Golf & Course Design from the year prior, and featuring both of the courses from that title (Sherwood and English Turn) as well as one additional new course (Baltusrol). The game offers stroke and skins play for up to four players, as well as a driving range and a practice mode. The course editor from the PC version, however, has been removed.
title: Jack Nicklaus' Power Challenge Golf

description: Sansan is a conversion of the popular board game Go, which allows the player to play online against distant opponents though the game's network service. It offers the ability to play against opponents who are not currently online, much like chess-by-mail, and also allows for sending short messages to the other player. Unlike most Meganet titles, it runs through Sansan's independently-run paid service, which has continued to be operational long after Sega's own service was discontinued.
title: Sansan

description:
Continuing the R.B.I. series, the 1993 entry updates the rosters, adding two new teams (Colorado and Florida), bringing the total to 28 teams, and nearly 700 players. Instead of a generic stadium, all 28 teams have their own ballparks modeled after the real deal. On top of the regular team vs team mode (in either a single game, best of 7, you vs the division, or you vs the entire league), you can spend time in a home run derby or fielding practice. Also includes rosters of every division champ from 1984 onwards for Game Breaker mode.

Play is either player vs computer, as either the home or visiting team, two players, or computer vs computer. Password saves allowing resuming the multi-game modes. Included is the ability to edit the teams; you can transfer players between teams to keep the rosters current, or just have some fun. Finally, the Game Breaker mode allows setting up a game in progress using any team, any inning, any score.

sample_screenshots.caption: Foul ball hit into the stands
Pitching the ball with a runner on base
Scenarios for the Game Breakers mode

title: R.B.I. Baseball '93

description:
Eliminate Down is a horizontally-scrolling shooter similar in style to Thunder Force. The player has several weapons that can be freely switched (forward shot, back shot, and missile), and can also change the speed of the ship. Enemies come from all directions, and certain waves will drop powerups, including shields and weapon upgrades. The player needs to collect five upgrades in order to improve their weaponry, but the upgrade affects all three weapons.

The game includes eight stages, most of which include both a midboss and a boss at the end, and three difficulty settings. There is also a minigame similar to Whack-a-Mole where there is a grid of ship icons, and the player must hit the rotating ships.

sample_screenshots.caption: Waiting for one of the cards to flip over
Shooting from the back of the ship

title: Eliminate Down

description:
Hyokkori Hyōtanjima: Daitōryō o Mezase! ("Aim for the Presidency!") is a sugoroku-style board game for up to four players based on the popular NHK children's show Hyokkori Hyōtanjima. Four characters from the show all decide they want to be the island's president, and so they set off to start campaigning.

The goal of each round is to collect the most points; points can be earned or lost based on the spaces the player lands on. The round ends when a player reaches the destination set at the start of the round, which gives a points bonus. The player with the most points after a set number of rounds is the winner.
title: Hyokkori Hyōtanjima: Daitōryō o Mezase!

description: NFL 98 is an NFL-licensed football game updated from Prime Time NFL Football, and one of the last NFL titles to be released on the Genesis. It features all 30 NFL teams and complete rosters for the 1997 season. Just like the previous title, there are season and exhibition modes, as well as team management options and a comprehensive in-game manual detailing the various aspects of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: It was a 73 yard kickoff returned for 35 yards.

title: NFL 98

description:
This game is one of the eight text adventures that chronicles the lives of characters before their story continues in Phantasy Star II. This particular game covers Hugh Thompson, a biologist who is tasked with investigating the rumors of a strange creature loose on the Motavian University campus.

Gameplay consists of exploring various locations, looking around them to find other characters to converse with in order to gain clues, and searching for items to take in order to use them to solve problems which helps further the plot.

Some items that can be picked up can be used for weapons during combat. When in combat, the players weapon's attack power is multiplied by a random dice roll to figure out the strength of the attack. The same rule applies to the enemy combatant's attack. The goal of combat is to drain all the enemy's HP.

sample_screenshots.caption: Text written in yellow indicates things of interest in that area
How the player moves from area to area

title: Phantasy Star II Text Adventure: Huey no Bōken

description:
This game is one of the eight text adventures that chronicles the lives of characters before their story continues in Phantasy Star II. This particular game covers Amy Sage, a doctor who is tasked with getting medicine to an elementary school that has been recently attacked by biomonsters.

Gameplay consists of exploring various locations, looking around them to find other characters to converse with in order to gain clues, and searching for items to take in order to use them to solve problems which helps further the plot.

Some items that can be picked up can be used for weapons during combat. When in combat, the players weapon's attack power is multiplied by a random dice roll to figure out the strength of the attack. The same rule applies to the enemy combatant's attack. The goal of combat is to drain all the enemy's HP.

sample_screenshots.caption: Text written in yellow indicates things of interest in that area
Dice rolls determine the strength of an attack

title: Phantasy Star II Text Adventure: Anne no Bōken

description:
This game is one of the eight text adventures that chronicles the lives of characters before their story continues in Phantasy Star II. This particular game covers Josh Kain, an aspiring although inept electrical engineer. His ineptness at repairing electronic devices, often destroying them in the process of trying to repair them, led him to become known as a "wrecker". A wrecker is someone who can trash anything electronic. Josh Kain also ran away from his hometown when he was only 14, and now at 18 he lives by himself in an apartment in the town of Lume. He must survive on his own while dealing with a local gang, who are interested in using him for his talents as a wrecker.

Gameplay consists of exploring various locations, looking around them to find other characters to converse with in order to gain clues, and searching for items to take in order to use them to solve problems which helps further the plot.

Some items that can be picked up can be used for weapons during combat. When in combat, the players weapon's attack power is multiplied by a random dice roll to figure out the strength of the attack. The same rule applies to the enemy combatant's attack. The goal of combat is to drain all the enemy's HP.

sample_screenshots.caption: How the player moves from area to area

title: Phantasy Star II Text Adventure: Kinds no Bōken

description:
This game is one of the eight text adventures that chronicles the lives of characters before their story continues in Phantasy Star II. This particular game covers Rolf Landale, a young orphan who is known around his town as an adept swordsman. After being challenged and defeated in a duel, Rolf leaves the orphanage and then spends the next 8 years training. When he comes back home, he finds out that one of the girls from the orphanage has been kidnapped, so now it's up to Rolf to go and rescue her.

Gameplay consists of exploring various locations, looking around them to find other characters to converse with in order to gain clues, and searching for items to take in order to use them to solve problems which helps further the plot.

Some items that can be picked up can be used for weapons during combat. When in combat, the players weapon's attack power is multiplied by a random dice roll to figure out the strength of the attack. The same rule applies to the enemy combatant's attack. The goal of combat is to drain all the enemy's HP.

sample_screenshots.caption: Text written in yellow indicates things of interest in that area

title: Phantasy Star II Text Adventure: Eusis no Bōken

description:
This game is one of the eight text adventures that chronicles the lives of characters before their story continues in Phantasy Star II. This particular game covers Anna Zirski, a counter-hunter. A counter-hunter hunts down and arrests hunters who have become criminals. Anna is tasked with capturing criminals holed up in a Motavian town. These criminals are accused of illegally accessing Mother Brain in order to disrupt the food production of that region. Anna must put a stop to these hackers.

Gameplay consists of exploring various locations, looking around them to find other characters to converse with in order to gain clues, and searching for items to take in order to use them to solve problems which helps further the plot.

Some items that can be picked up can be used for weapons during combat. When in combat, the players weapon's attack power is multiplied by a random dice roll to figure out the strength of the attack. The same rule applies to the enemy combatant's attack. The goal of combat is to drain all the enemy's HP.

sample_screenshots.caption: How the player moves from area to area
Text written in yellow indicates things of interest in that area

title: Phantasy Star II Text Adventure: Amia no Bōken

description:
This game is one of the eight text adventures that chronicles the lives of characters before their story continues in Phantasy Star II. This particular game covers Shir Gold, a child of a wealthy family who is bored with her mundane life and turns to becoming a thief for the thrills it brings. The goal of the game is to steal an expensive painting from a hotel exhibit without getting caught.

Gameplay consists of exploring various locations, looking around them to find other characters to converse with in order to gain clues, and searching for items to take in order to use them to solve problems which helps further the plot.

Some items that can be picked up can be used for weapons during combat. When in combat, the players weapon's attack power is multiplied by a random dice roll to figure out the strength of the attack. The same rule applies to the enemy combatant's attack. The goal of combat is to drain all the enemy's HP.

It is actually possible to lose at this game. For example, if Shir sets off a security alarm, it could lead to the game being over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Text written in yellow indicates things of interest in that area

title: Phantasy Star II Text Adventure: Shilka no Bōken

description:
The story of Pier Solar tells about Hoston, a young botanist who is on a quest to save his father from a mysterious illness. He hears of rumours that a cure to his father's disease can probably be found in the nearest forest, and Hoston, disregarding his mother's warnings, sets out to find the cure.

The game is a classical console-RPG with round-based battles, similar to the Phantasy Star series on the same system.

In addition to a cartridge, the game also makes use of the Sega Mega CD, if available, by playing music and effects from an included soundtrack CD.
title: Pier Solar and the Great Architects

description:
This game is one of the eight text adventures that chronicles the lives of characters before their story continues in Phantasy Star II. This particular game covers Rudolf Steiner, a soldier of the Motavian government. One day, while preparing to head home from the military base he was stationed at, Rudolph sees a large amount of smoke appearing over his home town. Worried about his wife and child, Rudolph rushes off to his hometown to see what the problem is.

Gameplay consists of exploring various locations, looking around them to find other characters to converse with in order to gain clues, and searching for items to take in order to use them to solve problems which helps further the plot.

Some items that can be picked up can be used for weapons during combat. When in combat, the players weapon's attack power is multiplied by a random dice roll to figure out the strength of the attack. The same rule applies to the enemy combatant's attack. The goal of combat is to drain all the enemy's HP.

sample_screenshots.caption: How the player moves from area to area

title: Phantasy Star II Text Adventure: Rudger no Bōken

description: This version of Mighty Morphin' Power Rangers: The Movie is a 2D beat-'em-up game. The game loosely follows the plot of the movie, with Ivan Ooze being the main villain. The player can choose between six Rangers, the main difference being in their color, strength, movement speed and special attacks. At some points Rangers use colossal assault vehicles known as “Zords” to fight bosses. The game features two-player simultaneous play. The game's soundtrack consists entirely of digitized versions of original music created for the TV show.

sample_screenshots.caption: Collect coins to gain health or score point

title: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie

description:
This game is one of the eight text adventures that chronicles the lives of characters before their story continues in Phantasy Star II. This particular game covers Nei, a half human, half bio-monster girl. She was found wandering around all alone and was then adopted by a middle aged couple. One day, a mob of villagers burned down Nei's adopted parents house with them inside it. Nei escapes and now she wanders around aimlessly through different villages, while being left with the terrible memories of the mob leader who ordered her house to be destroyed.

Gameplay consists of exploring various locations, looking around them to find other characters to converse with in order to gain clues, and searching for items to take in order to use them to solve problems which helps further the plot.

Some items that can be picked up can be used for weapons during combat. When in combat, the players weapon's attack power is multiplied by a random dice roll to figure out the strength of the attack. The same rule applies to the enemy combatant's attack. The goal of combat is to drain all the enemy's HP.

sample_screenshots.caption: How the player moves from area to area
Text written in yellow indicates things of interest in that area

title: Phantasy Star II Text Adventure: Nei no Bōken

description:
The relatively minor Looney Tunes character The Tasmanian Devil experienced a revival in the 1990s with the TV series Taz-Mania, starring Taz and his family. One of several games based on the license, the Genesis version features the same story as the other Sega versions, but has a unique design and set of levels.

Inspired by a tale his father told, Taz goes on a quest for the egg of a giant prehistoric seabird, which will lead him across the whole of Taz-Mania through 16 levels of platforming action. He must survive a desert, a jungle, a car factory, a mine and ancient ruins. Taz is able to run, jump, and spin fast to turn into his trademark whirlwind. While spinning, he can knock out most enemies he comes across. He can also pick up many different items and try to eat them or use them in another way. Most foods replenish his health, while eating hot peppers gives him a fire breath attack. Stars grant temporal invulnerability, while bombs should be thrown at enemies (and definitely not be eaten!).

Several levels feature boss fights. A break from standard platforming comes in the shape of a mine cart ride, where the cart must be raised or lowered to avoid collisions, and a wild river, which can only be crossed by jumping across fast-sinking tree logs, reminiscent of Frogger.

sample_screenshots.caption: Taz eating the S in Sega.

title: Taz-Mania

description:
Wolverine: Adamantium Rage sends fan favorite Marvel mutant Wolverine out to explore his past in a beat'em up/platformer, similar to, but different from the version released on the SNES.

The game begins in the Weapon X lab, and continues through the icy landscape of Dead Man's Land, the Canadian forests and a hallucinatory lunar scenery. In New York, Wolverine must make his way through the Inner Circle of the Hellfire Club, an underground dungeon, and the NYC sewers for a final showdown. Lots of enemies stand in his way: flying robot drones, armed guards, The Hand ninjas and Inner Circle bodyguards, among others. He can take them out with basic jumps, kicks and slashes, as well as link the basic moves into more powerful combos. When Wolverine takes damage, his mutant healing factor kicks in, (slowly) regenerating his health. Health packs should be sought out, however, because just sitting around waiting for the health to recharge is not an option: a timer slowly ticks down to the appearance of the android girl Elsie Dee, designed to destroy Wolverine. Her embrace means instant death.

Besides the basic enemies, many levels also includes a number of boss fights, some against faceless hardware like a giant robot or a helicopter, others against Wolverine's signature foes. These include classics like Sabretooth and Lady Deathstrike as well as many culled from early 1990s X-Men comics like Albert (an android replica of Wolverine), Cyber, Trevor Fitzroy and Shinobi Shaw. Information about all of the characters can be accessed from an in-game menu.

sample_screenshots.caption: Introduction frame - a furious Logan wants revenge!
Wolverine has quite a lot of moves, for example spinning in the air.
The robot dogs are tough and both cowards and persistent.

title: Wolverine: Adamantium Rage

description:
King of the Monsters 2 on the Sega Genesis is a slightly different game than the original Neo Geo version. While the original let you play one of three different monsters to go through side-scrolling beat'em-up stages and fight (non-playable) monster as boss enemies, the Genesis version was re-worked into a one-on-one fighter similar to the first King of the Monsters game.

Apart from Farmardy, all characters from the Neo Geo version are playable. To win, the player must defeat all other monsters and a clone of the played monster in a fight. The matches take place in areas built from the original levels, and feature destroyable landscapes and secondary enemies, both of which can be smashed to gain points and power-ups.

sample_screenshots.caption: To your right, you see the common land shark.

title: King of the Monsters 2

description:
Sport Games is a compilation comprising the following titles:

  • World Championship Soccer II
  • Super Real Basketball
  • Super Volleyball
title: Sport Games

description:
Warrior of Rome is a strategy game set during the Ancient Roman era. It is shown from a top-down perspective and all units are represented by icons on the square fields of the playing map. The basic gameplay is simple: on each of the four levels there are goals to fulfill, e.g. destroying pirate ships. To do so, the player chooses a unit and gives it the order to move somewhere. When hostile units meet, they fight automatically; the fights are shown in separate windows.

Besides movement, there are also other orders to give to each individual unit, e.g. building a palisade, making a trap, the movement speed and, most importantly, the retreat options. Then a unit automatically flees when a fight does not work out and, after a rest, it regenerates to full strength.

sample_screenshots.caption: The town looks ancient, doesn't it?

title: Warrior of Rome

description:
King Salmon: The Big Catch is a fishing competition simulator: a player has to spend a day fishing for king salmon. Activities simulated include driving a boat to choose the best place to fish, choice of lures, line lengths, fishing depths, driving a boat to troll for salmon and, finally, pulling the caught fish out. The objective is to overcome some fictional fishermen, played by computer, in terms of the fish caught.

Game also includes simple role-playing elements, as player's skill improve with time and experience and it's possible to catch bigger and better fish successfully.
title: King Salmon: The Big Catch

description: Go Net is a conversion of the popular board game Go, which allows the player to play online against distant opponents through the game's network service. Unlike most Meganet titles, it ran through Ai-System's independently-run paid service, which continued to be operational well after Sega's own Meganet service was discontinued. Though the service still exists, support for this specific version has long since ended. In addition to playing the game itself, players could also send short messages to each other (in hiragana), or view a dedicated message board for the service.
title: Go Net

description:
12 years ago, a lone foreign ship was attacked off the coast of Japan by the forces of warlord Oda Nobunaga. There were only two survivors, discovered by a ninja master named Kageha: an injured sailor named John, and his 3-year-old son. The sailor told Kageha with his dying breath that his ship had been attacked by Nobunaga, and the ninja master took the child as his disciple, training him in the ways of the ninja, and giving him the name Burai. Now, the young ninja sets out with his companions to have revenge on the evil warlord Nobunaga.

Ninja Burai Densetsu is a turn-based strategy game similar to Fire Emblem or Langrisser set in Sengoku-period Japan. The player takes turns with the computer, positioning individual units on the grid-based map, and attacking enemies. Units can also visit towns to purchase new equipment or recovery items; not just the player, but enemies may also flee to nearby towns when attacked. Each stage has a specific goal and a strict time limit, measured in days. Short scenes between stages move the story forward.

sample_screenshots.caption: Map, we have a long journey ahead of us
Battle scene: the main character (ninja) attacking the enemy archer

title: Ninja Burai Densetsu

description:
Super League '91 is a baseball simulation game, and the sequel to Super League (a.k.a. Tommy Lasorda Baseball). The game plays much the same as its predecessor, and includes Pennant Race, Open (Exhibition), and All Pro game modes.

Unlike its predecessor, this version features an official NPB license, and thus includes all 12 Central and Pacific League teams, complete with player names and stats from the 1991 season.

A reworked version of the game that includes audio commentary and MLB teams was released internationally as Sports Talk Baseball.

sample_screenshots.caption: These choices should not be made lightly, they really affect the outcome.
One should also be careful while treading this part.
Why does it look like everyone's around a goddamn golf hole...
You really should. Standing still after a home run is the worst thing you can do... You gotta show your fans how HAPPY you feel inside. So RUN! Run like the crazy fucker you are!

title: Pro Yakyū Super League '91

description:
Robot Battler is a simple action simulation game where the player builds a robot and pits it against another. In building their robot, the player must first distribute points to five different stats, and then may also purchase weapon and body parts. Once the setup is complete, it's off to battle.

The player directly controls the robot in battle, moving it around the arena and attacking with its weapons (if any are equipped). Using the weapons will deplete the robot's energy, though direct contact between the two robots will damage both of them, and is a viable attack if the energy is depleted. If the player's robot is victorious, additional stat points and money are earned, and the player moves on to the next fight.
title: Robot Battler

description: Medal City is a simple casino game collection that offers three different games: Poker, Black Jack, and Slots. Each game is for one player only, and is a basic reproduction of the real-life game. The player starts with 30 chips, and can freely choose between each game betting as they see fit. Winnings can be saved via password.
title: Medal City

description:
Dial Q o Mawase! is an unlicensed strip mahjong game. The player takes the role of a private detective hired by a woman to dig up dirt on her husband. In doing so, he goes to a secret underground mahjong club, where he must defeat young girls to extract information -- and their undergarments.

The mahjong itself is strictly a recreation of the traditional Chinese board game. However, after each round the player wins, the opponent will remove a part of their clothing, until eventually they are completely nude. After defeating an opponent, they will give you the phone number of the next target that must be interrogated, which doubles as a password. There are six different opponents to play against in total.

sample_screenshots.caption: I do like my brunettes. But... whatever... game over.
This game has no title screen at all. But there are babes.
Readheads are definitely my favorite. And I also have a thing for glasses.

title: Dial Q o Mawase!

description:
MiG-29: Fighter Pilot is a successor to MiG-29 Fulcrum by Simis; this time the theater of operations is the Middle East. The joined forces of NATO and the Commonwealth of Soviet States are to stop General Hasouz who is seeking to gain control over the world's oil resources. You are the pilot of the Russian-built MiG-29 and you need to accomplish several strategic missions to ensure the success of the operation.

As this is a simulation game, the MiG-29's control panel is recreated (displaying altimeter, compass, thrust indicator, radar and more), and many actions are done manually by the player (such as controlling brakes and landing gear, performing take off and landing, etc.). There are a number of weapons and an automatic targeting system to help successfully accomplish the missions. The MiG-29 is also equipped with flares and chaff used to avoid enemy fire.

The game is divided into 5 missions plus a tutorial mission. Mission objectives include destroying the enemy's command control and communications systems, escorting a submarine to safety, and destroying enemy Scud missiles. Mission score is based on the number of enemy structures and craft destroyed.

The game features real-time 3D polygon graphics and there are even several short video clips, something very uncommon for Genesis hardware.
title: MiG-29: Fighter Pilot

description:
Taiheiki is a turn-based strategy game, based on the television drama of the same name, which in turn is based on a famous 14th-century historical epic which chronicles the fall of the Hōjō clan during the Kamakura period of Japanese history.

The game is a grid-based strategy game in the tradition of Fire Emblem or Langrisser. Each side has multiple units, which can move depending upon the terrain. Conflicts between units are shown as animated sequences, and the player can determine formations, as well as issue and change orders to different troops at any time. Battles between enemy commanders take the form of a side-scrolling 1-on-1 action sword battle.

There are two scenarios available. The first casts the player as Takauji Ashikaga as he attempts to oust Godaigo and establish a new government, while the second follows Masashige Kusunoki and Yoshisada Nitta, who must try to protect Emperor Godaigo and his imperial rule. The two scenarios intertwine at various points, and graphical story sequences between each battle drive the story.

sample_screenshots.caption: Now it's just the two commanders left, you have full control over your unit in this situation

title: Taiheiki

description:
A five-game compilation cart released exclusively in Brazil. Contains the following games:

  • Flicky
  • Sega Soccer
  • Shadow Dancer
  • Super Monaco GP
  • Super Thunder Blade
title: Sega Top Five

description:
This compilation is exclusive to Europe and contains three previously released sports games on a single cartridge:* Super Monaco GP

  • Ultimate Soccer
  • Wimbledon Championship Tennis
title: SEGA Sports 1

description:
World Series Baseball 98 is the fourth Genesis game in the baseball series. This entry has the rosters and stats of the 1997 MLB season (including interleague play) as well as updated statistics for the 1996 season featured in the previous game. Once again all 28 teams are featured. The game types are identical to before: Exhibition, League, Playoffs, Batting Practice, Homerun Derby, and Classic Homerun Derby, along with All-Star games. Trading can be enabled or disabled. The gameplay and visuals are identical to the previous game. A new feature is that statistics are tracked through 27 categories and next to the overall progress in a league for instance, league leaders, team leaders, team statistics and team standings are saved to the cartridge battery.

Batting is shown from a behind view with three options: contact, normal or power. The player has to time the swing to make contact. While pitching the three options are fastball, splitter and changeup (in the previous game slide was offered instead of changeup). In pitching mode a rectangle is shown to determine the position of the ball. It can also moved out of the rectangle to trick the batter into a wide one and the accuracy is determined through the batter's statistics. During gameplay fielding can be done manually or by the computer. Runners have the ability to go back, advance or slide. Various line-up and strategy options can also be altered during gameplay.

sample_screenshots.caption: Opening sequence with the SEGA Sports logo

title: World Series Baseball 98

description:
International Rugby is a rugby game played from a top-down perspective. The game consists of tournament matches played as part of the world cup with countries such as England, USA, Argentina, France, Wales, Scotland, Fiji etc. In the options the type of tournament can be determined, along with the amount of wind and match length. Multiplayer is supported for two players.

At the kick off, during a scrimmage and whenever the ball goes over a side line, a meter appears to determine the power and curve. It is filled up automatically and the player has to press a button twice to time both aspects. While running with the ball, it can be passed along or kicked. In a defensive position it is possible to tackle and switch between players. Each player has individual statistics based on position, height, weight, speed, passing, rucking, tackling, tactics, kicking and injury. Fixtures for the world cup can be looked up on a separate screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: The ball is in the field.
Timing the meter to resume the play.

title: International Rugby

description:
Gunship is the Mega Drive version of the MicroProse helicopter series. Just like the original game the player gets to command a helicopter through a first-person perspective. Missions are preceded by a briefing and a planning stage. A map of the environment is shown from a top-down perspective with the starting position, enemy locations, fuel dumps, and the target. The player sets out custom waypoints to reach the target. Often a fuel refill is required to make it that far and it needs to be calculated in.

During missions the helicopter can be steered in any direction, but it is not necessary to keep track of waypoint directions, as they are automatically followed. The HUD contains the remaining distance, health, fuel, score, and a radar with enemies as red dots. There is a certain amount of freedom of movement and a voice warns about incoming missiles. Helicopters can be shot with a cannon. At a fuel dump the helicopter becomes vulnerable and the player can choose to disengage before the refueling is complete.

When the target is reached, an approach sequence is initiated. The game turns into a 2D 3rd-person side-scroller, unique to the series. There is freedom to move up and down and engage targets with the regular cannon or homing missiles in the air and on the ground. The helicopter can also turn 180 degrees to travel in the opposite direction. A yellow arrow marks the direction of the final target. In this sequence the player receives multiple lives (credits) to continue playing. In the first-person sequence death is final. These 2D sequences can be practiced as six scenario's in a simulator from the main menu.

sample_screenshots.caption: Destroy this target to complete the mission.

title: Gunship

description: Menghuan Shuiguo Pan: 777 Casino is a casino simulator where you choose whether you are a boy or girl and must walk around town from your hotel playing various casino games like slots and blackjack. You must buy tokens so each game can be played to make your fortune. The main town is viewed from a elevated angle. The game is a one or two player game.

sample_screenshots.caption: These dudes don't look oriental at all. Should have uploaded my face instead.
This actually reminds me of my grandpa's old car...
He particularly loved card games. They were almost his RUIN though.
But gaming was his number one vice.

title: Menghuan Shuiguo Pan: 777 Casino

description:
Despite sharing the name and the publisher of the contemporary SNES title, the Genesis version has similar gameplay, but looks different and was done by another development team. In this fishing simulator players get to participate in a fishing tournament. Starting at 7.30 in the morning, the player has until 4PM to take a boat on the lake and fish for bass to beat competitors. The boat can be steered freely using a top-down view until an appropriate spot has been found by checking the lowrance monitor. The game then switches to a first-person view, also showing the fisher from a side-view on a separate part of the screen, and it is possible to look around in the environment.

Casting is done using a power meter to determine the distance. As the bait sinks, a monitor can be checked for nearby fish. There are also visual clues through splashing water. The player can check the depth and reel in when needed. When a fish has been caught, it becomes a sensitive play with the line tension to make sure it does not snap shown through the side-view of the fisher. At the end of the day the boat can go back to the weighing area to determine the results. Money earned in the tournaments can be used to acquire new spin reels, bait reels, boats, lines and lures.

Next to the tournament there is a music player and a free fishing mode. In the free fishing mode every option can be customized, such as six types of lakes, the starting time, the direction and the strength of the wind, overall weather and the temperature.

sample_screenshots.caption: The yellow dots on the monitor show where the fish are.

title: TNN Bass Tournament of Champions

description:
TNN Outdoors Bass Tournament '96 is the sequel to TNN Bass Tournament of Champions. It shares many elements with the PC game of the same name, but that version has an isometric-style map and a full 3D view for the fishing sequences. Just like the original game it is a fishing simulator that allows the player to access a free fishing mode or to participate in a fishing tournament. First, equipment needs to be bought. It consists of lures, rods, reels, lines and boats. Better items can only be acquired by winning money in tournaments.

After selecting the equipment the game takes the player to a top-down map where one of the six available lakes can be explored. The included lakes exist in real life. They are Lake Okeechobee, Truman Reservoir, Lake Erie West, Dale Hollow, Lake Eufaula, and Bull Shoals. Through a monitor an appropriate spot for fishing can be found. Once set, the game then switches to a 3rd-person over the shoulder view, similar to the earlier SNES version instead of the previous Genesis game. Casting is done through a power meter and it is possible to do bad casts that need to be retried. Once in the water the camera switches to a top-down view inside the water. Players can watch the bottom surface and fish swimming by. When reeling in one of five available speeds can be chosen and the bait can still be moved. The game starts at 7.30 in the morning and the boat needs to return in time to weigh the fish.

In the free fishing mode various parameters can be defined such as the season, weather, starting time and wind strength. In a tournament these change dynamically. The game includes a music player for the soundtrack.

sample_screenshots.caption: Equipping what I bought in the shop.

title: TNN Outdoors Bass Tournament '96

description:
Game no Kanzume Otokuyō (Can of Games Economy Version) is a collection of 12 Meganet titles, released exclusively on the SEGA Channel service in Japan. Games included:

  • 16t
  • Awogue
  • Fatal Labyrinth
  • Flicky
  • Hyper Marbles
  • Ikasuze! Koi no Doki Doki Penguin Land MD
  • Medal City
  • Paddle Fighter
  • Putter Golf
  • Pyramid Magic
  • Robot Battler
  • Teddy Boy Blues
title: Game no Kanzume: Otokuyō

description:
Mahjong Cop Ryū is a combination of a Japanese-style adventure game and a 1-vs-1 mahjong game. It is a direct sequel to the coin-op strip mahjong game Sukeban Janshi Ryūko, and picks up the story directly after the destruction of the Janrōkai, an evil mahjong-playing organization. The player takes the role of an investigator named Ryū who is looking to find the true nature of an even greater threat that has taken the Janrōkai's place.

The main story mode features extended dialogue sequences, but these are largely linear and the only options are "speak", "show", and "threaten". In order to proceed with the story, the player must defeat a variety of colorful opponents at mahjong. The actual mahjong play is largely traditional, though there are several special techniques the player can use to gain an advantage.

In addition to the story mode, there is also a free battle mode, as well as a mahjong quiz mode and several options to change the rules of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: This guy reminds me of the Terminator.

title: Mahjong Cop Ryū

description:
One of several games based on the Mobile Police Patlabor manga and anime franchise, 98-Shiki Kidō seyo! (Launch, Type-98!) is an original scenario where the player takes the role of a new Division 2 recruit. Shortly after the player joins up, a silent military coup attacks their headquarters, and the new recruit must work together with the other Division 2 members to stop it.

The game is structured as a hybrid Japanese-style RPG/adventure game. The player moves and fights in a traditional RPG style, but entering certain locations switches the game to a command-adventure style where the player can ask characters about different subjects, investigate items of interest, and collect and use a wide variety of items. At first the player controls only the recruit, but other characters later join the player's party.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oh, it's the Black Chickens of Death. So THIS is where the Black Plague really started... poor rats got all the blame though.
I remember getting dizzy with all that green forced upon me...
The memories just come flowing back. This top down view brings me back to old favorites like Dragon Quest (and it's wondrous rip-off, Juvei Quest!).
Funny how they portrayed technology back then.
Lookin' good with that polished metal shell.

title: Kidō Keisatsu Patlabor: 98-Shiki Kidō seyo!

description:
Sangokushi Retsuden is a turn-based strategy game set in Three Kingdoms-era China. The game takes place on one large map representing the whole of China, which features numerous strongholds held by different factions and many strategic and geographic features.

The player must give orders to each of their generals, such as to move, attack, or retreat, as well as allocate resources such as money and food as necessary. Individual generals will level up as their experience increases. Battles between generals are presented as side-view action sequences.

The game features three scenarios, beginning in 189, 200, and 215CE, multiple difficulty settings, and multiple commanders to choose from for each scenario. Up to three players can play simultaneously, each controlling a different faction.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choosing a year and some parameters

title: Sangokushi Retsuden: Ransei no Eiyūtachi

description:
Warrior of Rome II is a real-time strategy game similar to Populous, in which the player controls the Roman Army. The player controls a number of individual units in each map, which can be directed in various ways, such as to approach and attack a particular target, construct or demolish structures, or form or disband units.

The single-player scenario begins with Caesar receiving orders from Rome to suppress a revolt in Asia. There is also a free battle mode for one or two players that features several dozen maps to choose from. A unique feature of the game is the highly configurable menu system. The player can move, resize, rearrange, and close any of the different information windows as they see fit.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sending out troops to build a colosseum

title: Warrior of Rome II

description:
The alien race of Smogulans, led by Czar Zoster, is invading the Earth, namely the town of Tromaville. The only force that can stop the invasion are the Toxic Crusaders.

Toxic Crusaders for Genesis, based on the animated TV series, is a side-scrolling beat-'em-up. The player can choose to play as either Toxie, NoZone or Junkyard, with no actual difference for the gameplay, which consists of running around beating aliens with melee or distance attacks and sometimes jumping over or evading deadly gaps or pools of water.

As the action moves from the streets of Tromaville through the Toxic Park, Smogulan space ship and other locations, leading up to the palace of Czar Zoster on Smogula planet, the traps get progressively harder to avoid. In certain levels the protagonist can use a motorized skateboard, helicopter or a motor boat. There are a number of power-ups to be found, including limited invincibility and speed-up.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game starts with a skateboarding sequence. Jump to continue on foot.
You can board a helicopter and attack on the ground and in the air.

title: Toxic Crusaders

description:
While the PC version migrated to 3D graphics, NHL 96 on Genesis retains the classic 2D diagonal-down view of the series, while offering different playing modes than the SNES version.

The game features players and teams from the 1994-95 NHL season. Game modes include Regular Games, Shootouts, Playoffs (in either single elimination or best-of-seven mode), and a full season. Creating and trading players is also supported.

While the real NHL season was shortened due to a lockout, the game includes the originally planned 82-game schedule. In NHL 95, any scheduled game could be played. This has been changed in favor of the player picking their team and taking it through the entire season. A scheduled game can either be played or simulated, and the season can be ended at any time, skipping to the playoffs based on current league standings.

Compared to previous entries, many more moves for players have been added, including give-and-gos, one-timers, the spin-o-rama, fake shots and drop passes. For the first time, the game has selectable difficulty levels, while fights between players make a return, having last been featured in NHLPA 93.
title: NHL 96

description:
The Genesis version of Mighty Morphin Power Rangers is a one-on-one fighting game based on the TV series, featuring two playing modes: one-player scenario mode and two-player battle mode.

In scenario mode, the evil Rita Repulsa sends a number of her monsters (and the evil Green Ranger) after the Power Rangers, who must defeat each in one-to-one combat. Before every bout, players can select a different ranger to play. Each of the five matches consists of two rounds: after the first round, the monster usually changes form into a larger version of itself (the Green Ranger summons his Dragonzord instead), which the Power Rangers must then fight again using their Megazord mecha. After the Green Ranger is defeated, he also becomes available as a playable character for the remaining fights.

In battle mode, players can select from the six rangers, four monsters and two Zords to fight each other in best-of-three matches in almost all combinations (the Zords and the Cyclopsis monster cannot be matched against any of the rangers, and both players cannot play the same character).

Two of the controller's buttons are used for normal and fierce attacks, while blocking is done by either pulling back from the enemy for standard blocks or pushing both buttons simultaneously for a powerful block that reflects even enemy projectiles. Button combinations unleash different special moves for each character.
title: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers

description: Art Alive allows the player to create drawings. Art Alive comes with over 50 graphics and animations ready to be used in the player's drawings. Use drawing tools such as the pencil, eraser, paint bucket, paint can, line tool, rectangle tool, and circle tool to create original artwork. The game also includes pre-drawn backdrops that can be colored in with the paint bucket.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting off with a blank, white canvas with the tools being displayed above it.
The screen fills up with color from the paint bucket tool.

title: Art Alive

description:
With the versions for PC and 32-bit consoles having moved into the realm of real 3D graphics, Madden NFL 97 on Genesis retains the classic view of the series, updating it with different features and options compared to the SNES release.

The game features the 30 regular NFL teams of the 1996 season, the 1996 All-Madden team and 68 classic NFL teams, from the '52 Lions to the '95 Cowboys.

Standard playing modes include exhibition, a full season and playoffs including the Super Bowl. In seasons and playoffs, any game can be either played or simulated (with the exception of the Super Bowl, which must be played). Special modes are Custom League and Custom Tournament. A custom league can be set up between 4 to 10 players with freely selectable teams. Every team plays every other team once at home and once away. For 8 players and up, teams are divided into two divisions. The division champions face up in a final playoff. The custom tournament can be set up for 4, 8 and 16 players competing for the Madden Bowl in single elimination mode.

Quarter length can be set from 5 to 15 minutes. Weather conditions can be set between fair, rain and snow. Further options are two skill levels (Pro and Madden), John Madden commentary, freely definable audibles, eight different penalties that can be set to different levels, player fatigue, injuries and substitutions. Play calling mode can be set to a bluff mode, offense and pass catching can be set to manual or automatic, and all-player mode allows one to control any player on offense, even those with no direct part in the play. Player records and season/playoff progress are saved via battery. Records are saved for each individual player, with eight slots available.

The game also features custom rosters via player creation (stats are set via a number pool), trading and signing of free agents.

Besides the custom leagues and tournaments, there is multiplayer support via the 4-Way-Play, allowing for any combination of team or versus play. One player always calls the plays and controls the quarterback, while others can select which player to control.
title: Madden NFL 97

description:
Lakers vs. Celtics on Genesis is an update of the game of the same name for PCs. It features the same perspective, same action-oriented gameplay with an emphasis on offense, and the same game modes: exhibition games and the playoff tournament mode.

It features ten NBA teams from the '89-'90 season. Compared to the PC version, it also adds more signature moves, different home- and away-jerseys, animated coaches, TV-style scenes from other games in the halftime show, player portraits for the starting five, voice samples for the referee and counts the number of personal fouls a players has committed, making it possible for them to foul out.

sample_screenshots.caption: Called for charging. Happens way too often.
Lakers and Celtics ready for the tip-off

title: Lakers versus Celtics and the NBA Playoffs

description:
The Madden football series appears for the last time on the Genesis with Madden NFL 98. With PC and next-gen console versions having moved to 3D graphics, the Genesis version retains the classic view of the series. Most of the playing modes are the same as on the SNES, but the Genesis version has its own selection of teams and gameplay options.

Players can select from the 30 teams of the 1997 NFL season, the 1997 All-Madden team, an EA Sports and a THQ team, plus 68 classic NFL teams, from the 1950s to the 1990s. Playing modes include exhibition games (now optionally as a best-of-three or best-of-five series), seasons and playoffs. There is also an option to replay all Super Bowls since 1988. The game tracks records in 13 categories. A new feature are hot and cold streaks for teams, in which their recent playing history influences their current stats. Player creation and trading returns from the predecessors. As in Madden 97 (but unlike in the SNES version), player stats are set from a point pool. There are options for salary caps and trading deadlines in seasons and playoffs, and it is always possible to play with the regular instead of the modified rosters. During a game, it is again possible to control any player on the field by toggling Any Player Mode (a feature not available on the SNES).

sample_screenshots.caption: Extra point kicks aren't that hard

title: Madden NFL 98

description:
The popular dice-puzzle game Cascade originated on the planet Cascadia, and it is on this planet where the most intense tournaments take place. Creatures from all over the galaxy travel to Cascadia in hopes of joining the ranks of the greats. Thankfully, Cascade is a friendly game in which most players support one another, and share tips. So, while not all challengers receive a trophy, they often make new friends in pursuit of one.

Cascade is a puzzle game. Players maneuver dice around a grid, trying to form numerical combinations that may then be "blasted" to progress against the current opponent. Clearing combinations that include starred dice, and / or clearing multiple sets of combinations, speeds up the progression. Opponents are defeated when the player's energy plug rises to the top of the screen. A competitive two-player mode is also offered.

sample_screenshots.caption: Warp 01, the start of your adventure.

title: Cascade

alternate_titles.title: Huan Le Tao Qi Shu: Smart Mouse

description: Smart Mouse is a single-screen maze action game with puzzle elements. The player controls a mouse who must navigate a maze filled with enemies. The mouse can push the blocks which make up the maze walls; a moving block will keep moving until it hits another block, and crush every enemy in its path. After squashing the last enemy in a level, the player moves on to the next. There are a total of 100 levels, and the player is able to save their progress using passwords.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game gives out a password after a game over.
Being hit by a regular enemy.
Starting the level - enemies are about to come out from under those manhole covers.

title: Smart Mouse

description:
Oh Mummy Genesis is an unofficial enhanced remake of Oh Mummy. The player controls one of two adventurers sent to Egypt by the British Museum to collect a set of five royal mummies and all the treasure they can carry. Gameplay takes the form of a single-screen maze game, similar to Pac-Man. Each floor of the dungeon has a grid of sarcophagi; the player must walk a full circle around a sarcophagus to open it, and must collect at least one key and one treasure before moving on to the next level. Unlike the original game, Oh Mummy Genesis features a slightly more involved story and each tomb is capped off with a boss battle.

In addition to the remake, a faithful port of the original Amstrad CPC version of Oh Mummy is also included.

After the initial print run sold out, the game's ROM was made available for free download from its official website.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oh Mummy Genesis opens with a cutscene providing the remake's new backstory.
Level layouts are accurate to the original game.
Walking around a sarcophagus opens it; there are several different possible contents. The player needs to collect at least a key and one treasure to exit.
The first boss! This sphinx obscures the player's view, and will swoop down to attack.

title: Oh Mummy Genesis

description: CrazyBus is an unlicensed Venezuelan SEGA Genesis tech demo from 2004, created to test out the author's BASIC compiler and sound driver. The only point of interaction is to move buses left and right, and honking the horn.

sample_screenshots.caption: It's time to pick a bus!
Here's some instructions to prepare yourself with before things get, well, crazy.

title: CrazyBus

description: This Sega Channel exclusive features several new levels originally intended for Garfield: Caught in the Act.
title: Garfield: The Lost Levels

description:
Sumo Slam! is a party game for up to twelve players with sumo wrestlers challenging each other on a platform. The game is played on a fixed-screen showing a platform with the sumo wrestlers using a top-down view. The wrestlers cannot be controlled directly. They constantly rotate in a stationary position at a fixed speed. By pressing and holding down a button the player makes the wrestler go forward in the direction he is facing for as long as the button is pressed. As soon as the button is released the wrestler starts rotating again. The game can be played in different game modes: Sushi (collect sushi playing along against a time limit), Chase (a game of tag) and Fight (bump other wrestlers off the platform). As only a single button or key press is used up to twelve players can participate simultaneously in local multiplayer. When playing alone the computer controls the opponents.

The game is almost identical to the 2004 J2ME title Sumo Smash!, which in turn is based on Jumbo Rumble, but it is not clear how the games are related.
title: Sumo Slam!

description:
Mega Cheril Perils is a 2D platform game based on the 2010 ZX Spectrum title Cheril Perils. It keeps some elements of the original game as well as the premise, but both visually and for the gameplay there are many differences. The game stars the character Cheril. Wearing no clothes she leaves her homeland, the jungle of Badajoz, to start a life in the city. When she arrives there she discovers the city is overrun by zombies. A virus created by the pharmaceutic enterprise Parasol meant to make everyone beautiful was transported in a cistern truck not properly cleaned. The previous content was morapio double-malt and the mix of the two substances has an unusual side effect: it turns people into brain-eating zombies. Now the city has been shut down by the mayor using a barrier. The only way for Cheril to leave the city is by killing all zombies to clean the streets and convince the mayor the city is safe again.

Cheril needs to navigate platforms and can only defeat zombies by jumping on top of them. These zombies take on many shapes also as animals and flying creatures. Instead of one level the game now consists of five separate stages with a password provided after completing the previous one to enter them directly. Each level consists of a series of single-screen rooms, linked together horizontally and vertically to offer exploration. The game shows how many zombies need to be defeated near the top of the screen and once they are all dead the level is completed automatically. Next to platform elements with moving sections sometimes she also needs to push barrels to create passages. Certain sections are blocked off by a dirty old man. He only lets Cheril pass when she gives him a piece of lingerie and those need to be located first. A single hit with an enemy or spikes immediately makes Cheril lose one of the nine lives she starts with. Sometimes hearts appear to provide an additional life.

An entirely new element is that each room now contains a device that stop all enemies in their tracks for ten seconds. When Cheril activates it by jumping on top of it, the screen turns monochrome and a countdown is started. All enemies freeze, but platforms still move. When the countdown is over the colour returns and enemies start moving again. This is a core gameplay mechanic as enemies can now only be defeated when they are frozen. Jumping on top of them while they are moving makes Cheril lose a life. The freeze mechanic carries over between rooms, so a countdown started in one screen goes on in the next, leading to some environment based puzzle-solving.

Next to the free download release there was a crowdfunded release with the game on a PAL/NTSC compatible cartridge along with a box and instructions. Based on the tier different extras were provided, such as having your name listed in the game and the manual, a Mojon Twins T-shirt or becoming a character in the game replacing Cheril as the protagonist.

sample_screenshots.caption: Enter a password to enter a later stage right away.
Cheryl freezes time, the countdown is going.
Opening screen thanking backers crowdfunding the game.

title: Mega Cheril Perils

description:
Mega Mindtris is a falling block puzzle game for one or two players based on the concept of the earlier Mindtris mobile games. It is played on a field that consists of five columns. Single blocks drop down and they each contain a number based on the powers of two (1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256). The goal is to create lines lining up five blocks that each contain the number that matches the block in the goal field. For instance: if the goal field contains the number 8, a line disappears when five blocks containing 8 are lined up next to each other horizontally. With each new line formed the goal changes.

When a block is dropped on top of another and together they form a power of two vertically, the sum of blocks is added and only the bottom block remains with the total sum. For instance: if there is a column with the blocks 1, 2 and 4 on top of each other, dropping a 1 on them adds them all up to a single block containing 8. There are also multiplication blocks, for instance changing an 8 into a 16 by dropping a 2x on top of it.

The game can be played with four difficulty levels forming two game modes. Alone is an endless game mode playing an infinite game without an opponent or power-uss. The other game mode comprises the difficulty levels easy, normal and stupid. There the game is played against a computer opponent. The game can also be played against a friend. When not playing alone a random power-up is provided with each line. They provide a bonus or hinder the other players. They can for instance provide 50 extra points, add lines, freeze or speed up the gameplay, invert horizontal movement, steal a power-up, blast blocks or change the field.

sample_screenshots.caption: Countdown to the start of the game

title: Mega Mindtris

description:
SupraKillminds is a fast-paced puzzle title based on the game Quartet. The goal of the game is to assemble gems by fitting four pieces together. A piece with one of four available colours appears in the middle of the screen. The player has to sent it to one of the four quadrants using the four directions on the D-pad. Based on the form it automatically moves to the correct part of the quadrant. When a complete quadrant is formed, points are scored and the pieces disappear. More points are provided for creating gems completely of the same color, but this is not required. Even if all parts have a different color points are still awarded. When a gem is made and all quadrants are then empty, the largest amount of points is awarded (500) as well as an extra life.

At the start of the game five lives are provided. A life is lost when a piece is accidentally sent to an occupied space or when time runs out before a move is made. Only a small amount of time is available to decide. For every 1,000 points the available time per move is decreased. It starts with two seconds per move.

The game was released on two types of cartridges as a mail order release, but also as a free download.

sample_screenshots.caption: Send the pieces into any of the four available directions.
A set has been completed on the right.
Mistake: a piece was sent to a place with no room.

title: SupraKillminds

description: The Sega Channel version of Sonic 3D Blast was split into two parts due to memory limitations. This first part contains the first four zones (Green Grove, Rusty Ruin, Spring Stadium, and Diamond Dust). Upon completing them, the player is given a password that allows them to continue from the first zone of Sonic 3D Blast: Part Two while keeping their lives and score.
title: Sonic 3D Blast: Part One

description: The Sega Channel version of Sonic 3D Blast was split into two parts due to memory limitations. This second part contains the final three zones (Volcano Valley, Gene Gadget, Panic Puppet) and the last boss. In order to play, players have to enter a password earned from beating Sonic 3D Blast: Part One; this starts them off at Volcano Valley with their score and lives from Part One intact.
title: Sonic 3D Blast: Part Two

description:
Thomas the Tank Engine & Friends is a game primarily meant for children.

Before going into the game proper, players are first given five different coloring book pages to fill in with each page based on the television show's characters.

The main portion of the game is split into three modes. The modes are Game, Race, and Explore. Game mode has Sir Topham Hatt giving the player objectives such as finding a mine car, a log car, and a passenger car, and bringing them to a specific train station. The more speedier the player completes their task the higher their score will be. Race mode has the player racing against an opposing train. Explore mode allows the player to freely drive around on the train tracks with no particular objectives. The game offers an easy, medium, and hard difficulty level.

sample_screenshots.caption: I need to find two wagons and bring them back to the station.
Some still need to be colored in.

title: Thomas the Tank Engine & Friends

description:
After getting trapped inside a movie projector, Spot has to find his way out while also rescuing other spots who are in the same predicament.

Spot goes through different levels that are represented by different movie set genres. These movie set locations include things like a ship, a haunted house, and a temple. In these levels Spot has to rescue a certain percentage of spots while shooting at enemies that get in his way.
title: Spot Goes to Hollywood

description: Unlike the computer version which consists of one long race with intermittent stops at gas stations, this version features three different races. The game also adds another car, the Lamborghini Diablo, which was not in the computer version.

sample_screenshots.caption: What's the matter, officer, were 200 mph too much?
Yes, but I can't ride a tricycle and contribute screenshots to MobyGames at the same time!

title: The Duel: Test Drive II

description: While this version of Spider-Man features the same story and similar gameplay to the SNES version, the game has completely different levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Run away from the incoming wall.
The game starts out in the dark.

title: Spider-Man

description: Chess is an unlicensed chess game. It is unknown whether it has any relation to the unreleased Sega Channel game Chessmaster. The game closely simulates realistic chess games. The chess board, which is 3D by default, can be customized for a top-down view and the setting to have white or black at the bottom. Options include the ability to turn off sound and music. The game can be played against the computer or another player. The difficulty level for the computer opponent can be determined from one to eleven.
title: Chess

description:
Mega Games Almanac is a compilation release by the Spanish publisher 1985 Alternativo on a single cartridge.

The included games are:

  • Mega Mindtris (updated version including support for the publisher's Mega QR powered online ranking)
  • Oh Mummy Genesis
  • Uwol: Quest for Money

All three games were already released standalone previously. There are also three playable demos:

  • Antarex (2D side-scrolling shooter set in space)
  • DJ Chip Warrior (DDR-like game)
  • Tro-Now (Tron-style lightcycle game)

Of these demo games only Tro-Now was already released in full, the other two were still in development.
title: Mega Games Almanac

description:
Tro-Now is a variant of the classic Tron light cycle game for up to four players simultaneously. The homebrew game was originally created for the 2015 bitbitJAM competition. On a single screen shown using a top-down view the bikes move forward at a fixed speed and can only be made to rotate 90 degrees left or right. They leave behind a trail in the same colour of the bike and have to avoid crashing into each other's vehicle or trail / wall.

While lives are endless, points are scored while moving, so the player that keeps riding without crashing keeps gaining points. After three minutes the game ends and the player with the highest score wins. The game can also be played in single-player, with the option to go against two or four riders. When in multiplayer the four players use two gamepads: one player uses left and right to steer and the other the A and B buttons on the same gamepad.

sample_screenshots.caption: The start of a game with two riders.
Red's got me cornered again, but is going to crash too.
A custom loading screen (but part of the game)

title: Tro-Now

alternate_titles.description: PlayOnRetro cartridge version product page title
alternate_titles.title: Miniplanets

description:
Miniplanets is a homebrew and open source arcade-like game. The player controls the character Qisha through around the globes of 3D planets that wrap around with platformer-centric gameplay. The game consists of five planelagos of nine miniplanets each, of which Qisha is the protector. Each planelago used to be guarded by one of his children, but one day they were turned into statues by an unknown force. Qisha needs to go through each planelago to retrieve crystals that bring back his children and banish the force.

Qisha can be moved in eight directions and only a single button is used to jump. To complete a level he needs to reach a coloured area after first collecting all keys in the environment. Each planelago has a different theme. Challenges include avoiding deadly water, navigating past moving platforms, avoiding bombs and electricity, staying on conveyor belts etc.

With the default game option only 60 seconds are provided to complete a miniplanet, but this setting can be changed. Qisha starts with five lives and an encounter with a hazard is deadly right away. Extra lives are provided for every 15,000 points, but this setting too can be changed. A password system is used with a password for each completed planelago. Points are scored by completing miniplanets quickly, as the remaining time is converted into points.
